website_summaries.verdict: An affordable airbrush for the first-time user.
pros: Dual-action airbrush at a great price point
Can be used with a variety of different paints and media
Unique 0.35 mm needle is great for fine details

customer_reviews.title: Finest lines
customer_reviews.text: Love this airbrush. So easy to use. Makes the finest lines. Cleans easily too. Out does my Paash talon. If you want to do the tiniest of detail, this is the brush. Perfectly balanced. The price is great too. Won't buy anything but Iwata for now on.
customer_reviews.author: David Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Should have "Professional" in the title
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing miniatures and models for a long time, mostly using a brush except to prime. Recently bought a cheap Masters brush and compressor to get started airbrushing. Feeling comfy I bought one of these, all I can say is WOW! Night and day difference from the cheapos, the second I pulled the trigger I knew. Totally worth every penny, and I stole the trigger-stop from the cheapo and it fits and works perfectly, instant upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Beginners: Do Yourself a Favor and Just Get This Airbrush
customer_reviews.text: I've used the cheaper kits that you'll find on here and the airbrushes are just awful to learn on and awful to use. I caved and got this airbrush because it would get here fast and was the gravity feed style I was used to. It's WONDERFUL. I love this little airbrush. Just make sure you pay attention to how you pull it apart when cleaning because otherwise you'll be watching a lot of videos on how to get it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Not a true iwata product
customer_reviews.text: Its ok i wish i had known its not made by iwata its a import with there name
customer_reviews.author: David H. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Airbrush, and Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: While I'm not terribly experienced with airbrushing, I came from this, which was a decent kit with an absolutely terrible brush. This one is easily 10x better. Maybe more. I absolutely love it. The dual action is really nice. You can keep air flowing at a steady rate while varying the amount of pain dispensed. The parts all feel solid with no leaks or any issues of any kind, really. I only wish the smaller canister had a lid as well. I honestly don't know why it doesn't, but the large canister satisfies all of my needs, anyways. Would absolutely buy another if anything happens to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great value for novice airbrusher
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this for shoe customization. It seems like a great value. Not too expensive and gets the job done. The only frustrating thing is cleaning the sprayer (nozzle??) there is a super tiny part that (supposedly) needs to be removed for thorough cleaning...it breaks very easily. And the replacement part is $15 or so. It may have had some to do with operator error, he seems to have mastered the process and hasn’t had an issue in the past month. All in all seems like a great tool, especially for a novice or someone exploring a new hobby
customer_reviews.author: jrm37'fugitive

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely one of the best bang for your buck airbrushed out there!
customer_reviews.text: A really amazing price on such a quality airbrush! If you remove the air cap, you get very tight precise detailed lines. The cut outs inside the box are a great way to store the airbrush to keep it safe and organized. Seriously, if you are looking to get into airbrushing, don't hesitate to try this one out. It sprays as good as any 4-500 dollar airbrush I have bought in the past. You can't really go wrong with Iawata anyway. I love the gravity feed cup myself. A little more work to clean between colors, but worth it in my opinion. I can't believe this brush sells at the price it does.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Im new to this hobby with airbrushes and i had another one that was a lot cheaper and it didn’t last to long before it clogged up on me. I got this Iwata airbrush and it has been great. I truly recommend this to anyone wanting to get into airbrushing.
customer_reviews.author: manoleto

customer_reviews.title: Got a used, dirty airbrush
customer_reviews.text: Airbrush was very clearly used. Found that out when my white mixed with the red that the last purchaser had failed to fully clean out. Buyer beware that returns are resold without sufficient checks to make sure the item is good as new. Ironically, I'll be returning it cleaner than I received it. I should charge a cleaning fee. I also found that this brush felt sloppier and less controlled than my badger 150, so would have returned it anyway. Not sure if that's consistent with the model, or if it's possibly just defective and the reason the other buyer also returned it.
customer_reviews.author: DrShaw

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine... until it broke
customer_reviews.text: Learned quickly that paint has to be VERY thin to work in this brush. I needed to clean it out thoroughly after learning this. As I was using the small wrench provided to put the nozzle back on, the nozzle broke! Treads broke right off. Now I’m in another $15 to replace that. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Renna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how a quality air brush would be so much better that the cheaper ones. This thing is awesome! I use it for painting model train stuff. Cleaning is easier, but you still have to take it completely apart. Some better reassembly instructions would have been appreciated. Still the paint flow for latex and acrylic paints was super. I never clogged one time unlike my previous experiences. FYI....I am real amateur at air brushing and this brush was super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: I'm a model making beast
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th iwata gun and like all of them the neo is nicely weighted, balanced, has great control and couldn't be more simple. Used it for the first time today and was very impressed by how smooth and precise it sprayed. Fine lines and pinpoint accuracy Are a must for me and this little beauty has it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for price... excellent entry level airbrush.... far better than the siphon type I had before...
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality air brush
customer_reviews.text: At such a low cost people usually dismiss airbrushes but this one is amazing! Does the job so well and needs little maintenance. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Suttell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I waited to write a review on this airbrush till I used it enough to really see if it was worth the money or time. And without a doubt I have to say this is the best airbrush for beginners like myself. Easy to use and clean. Just play with it and make sure you buy a quick release with the adjustment valve. Makes things easier for you. And remember to thin down your paints so the airbrush doesn’t clog up on you.
customer_reviews.author: lucas silva

customer_reviews.title: Very good for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Got this one after a complete fiasco with cheap chines airbrush Master G23. Movement of lever is smooth. Big plus is the selection of two cups, or you can opt out for no cup at all for a small job. The paint that Master G23 was clogging with, no clogging here at all. Cleaning is easy. And for the better result blow it with an airbrush cleaner or all-purpose cleaner from Lysol with needle removed to clean up nozzle from the paint residue. I highly recommend for a beginner as myself. It’s cost more than that cheap chines G23, but it is worth it. Some learning curve required.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Best $50 beginner Airbrush you will ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: All the other reviews say this but for $50 this is the best bang for your buck. Hands down one of the best airbrushes I have used so far. This airbrush replaced a Badger (with Badger being Latin for "hot garbage") The trigger action is smooth and it sprays evenly. If you aren't sure airbrushing is for you and don't want to go all in for a more expensive model just give this one a go.
customer_reviews.author: Alpharius77

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner airbrush that's easy to use and learn
customer_reviews.text: i am new to airbrushing, bought a single action bottom fed at first, but didn't like how hard it is to clean it, and it requires more PSI out of compressor. Got this IWATA to try out gravity fed, and so far, the experience is great. the gravity fed works so much better with my IWATA Ninja compressor, because it only goes up to 18psi. for the price, I don't have anything to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Great airbrush for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first airbrush so I had no idea what to expect. I use it for model painting and have been happy overall. Easy to clean. The o-ring that goes on the feed cup will disintegrate quickly if you use lacquer paint and cleaner. Iwata customer service is excellent. I will likely stick with them when I eventually upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Xuse

customer_reviews.title: No need to buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been airbrushing for about six months and have been using various airbrushes. By far, this is the best one I’ve used. The spray pattern is perfect, and it’s the smoothest spray of the other ones that I’ve used. To be honest, it’s waaaaayyyy underpriced. I would buy it for much more than $60, and it has been very consistent and durable. Definitely one of the best airbrushes on the market!
customer_reviews.author: K. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Iwata  has no information on airhose adaptor fitting
customer_reviews.text: It is almost impossible to get thread size the Neo air brush. If you have an existing compressor and hose, it is very painful to find adaptor information. The Iwata website has no information on fittings, adaptors, or thread size. And good luck with Amazon too, their search algorithm is poor at best.
customer_reviews.author: Leopold

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Im new to this. Bought this to replace what came with compressor kit. Night and day comparison. Now to learn to use it. Easy to clean and spray is great. Been mixing my own acrylics. The neo has been forgiving so far for someone learning. The kit gun was not so forgiving, and I would have to get mixture just right.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: bought due to error
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would fit my compressor from another air brush I already have that I wanted to just update due to multiple problems with the brand. It would not fit my compressor system, in fact it would not work unless I have the compressor made for this brush. I so wanted it to work. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: JayefromJersey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Airbrush Tattoos!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely ADORE these airbrushes! I use them for doing airbrush tattoos and they work perfectly for that. The spray is a little heavier than a fine tool, but that's perfect for spraying the thicker tattoo paint. I have 3 of them now and I promote them to anyone doing this kind of work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicho

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Did a small air brush test using thick Mission Models paints and also with thinned Liquitex heavy body acrylics. The NEO is best suited for primer or large coverage spraying. The 0.35mm is not suitable for detailing no matter which paint I used. The scale I used was 1/72 so as to test detailing. You’d need a whole lotta masking if you’re gonna use this as a fine detailing brush. So if you’re looking to have one brush that does it all then nope this is not it. Nonetheless, I got this one for large area coverage (4x4ft tested) and it does that pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: VJ Salvi

customer_reviews.title: Take good care of it and you have a premium airbrush at hand always.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and in good condition. Can tell box was never opened since it left the factory. All parts present and accounted for. Works better than I had hoped for, immediately attached to the hose provided with my Master Airbrush compressor! That part was impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Great !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to airbrushing and I was about to give it up after using the airbrush gun I received with an air compressor combo. That airbrush gun was terrible ! I gave this airbrush gun a chance from all the good reviews and the price was very affordable. WOW! What a difference, I am now extremely excited to continue learning how to airbrush after using this gun. Highly recommended for any beginner.
customer_reviews.author: michael p.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for the money
customer_reviews.text: This won't give you the smooth action of a higher end brush like an actual Iwata, but for the money it gets really close. Its relatively easy to clean inside and out, and the quality is far better than expected at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Roy S Judy

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good airbrush for the price
customer_reviews.text: A pretty good airbrush for the price. The Dual action offers enough feed control to accurately paint small detail as long as you adjust your air pressure accordingly. I'd definitely recommend this brush for beginners who want to learn the basics with a brush suitable for practically anything.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This gun was defective and was a complete nightmare to use. It came highly recommend by an industry pro, and I have no doubt the other ones out there are good. I do have to highly suggest to save up, and go for the HP-CS. It completely blows the Neo away and is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should recommend it as s package deal
customer_reviews.text: Performs to expectation, solidly build, if only can design it to be easier to clean, now real hassle to dismantle to clean each time after use, the internal should be coated with material that prevents paint from sticky If onto it, so easier to clean w/o dismantling the whole thing. This item needs an ultrasonic cleaner, Amazon should recommend it as s package deal,. Just my input
customer_reviews.author: yeow jim lee

customer_reviews.title: I great air brush at a great price
customer_reviews.text: What's to say. I great air brush at a great price. Worth every cent. 100% in performance and manufacturing. :)
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price of admission!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good airbrush. Really have no complaints about this model...its well build and really good quality of materials....feels good on the hand and has a very smooth trigger. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: FCM

customer_reviews.title: Great airbrush
customer_reviews.text: after using the cheaper chinese airbrushes i bought this and it is a night and day difference.I am gonna look into getting an even better airbrush now that i know better quality equals better results.If you are new to airbrushing i would get this to start out with and not waste your money on a cheaper airbrush,you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek C

customer_reviews.title: Great brush
customer_reviews.text: After struggling to revive a 30 year old Badger, I decided it was time to buy a new one. Unlike a much cheaper, siphon style brush I recently purchased, this one offered up no issues to spraying. The only thing that buyers should be aware of is that it won't fit the Paasche style hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Airbrush
customer_reviews.text: This airbrush is super high quality and I absolutely love it. The ink comes out smooth and it's easy to do fine detail as well as spray larger areas which is perfect for me as a costume maker. Highly recommended and I hope it lasts me a good long time!
customer_reviews.author: Sarikitten

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner Airbrush
customer_reviews.text: Simple to clean and it works good at an affordable price point. Just make sure to get airbrush cleaner and superlube to help keep its quality
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: First decent airbrush
customer_reviews.text: Just started airbrushing and decided to upgrade from a cheap bottom feed to a top feed. Wow, what a pleasant improvement. This was at a decent price point too.
customer_reviews.author: Bt

customer_reviews.title: I am a happy guy!
customer_reviews.text: So stoked! This is one of the best airbrushes I've ever owned! This is my third one! Easy to clean and so smooth!
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O Moreschi

customer_reviews.title: Great value, performs very well
customer_reviews.text: I use this airbrush to apply alcohol based dyes to my wood turning. The Neo is easy to use, easy to clean, and is a good value for the price. I tried cheaper air brushes and they were not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, need more artist ability but still learning to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, need more artist ability but still learning to use. Need to try other end to see if more detail can be added. Glad I purchased! Other items every help full also. Airbrush cleaner and cleaning pot make a great trio..
customer_reviews.author: shad2004

customer_reviews.title: Great airbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good airbrush for beginners and novice depending on what you mainly do but if you learning is great and it comes with 2 cup sizes
customer_reviews.author: leonel

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: Purchased before realizing it was a Chinese clone, instead of a real IAWATA. It is OK but not as nice as my 15 year old Badger 200. A real PITA to clean and clogs easily.
customer_reviews.author: McGee

customer_reviews.title: High quality and very affordable airbrush.
customer_reviews.text: This airbrush is great for beginners to experienced users. While it won't do extremely fine pencil lines, it will get very close and because it is a gravity feed brush it requires lower pressures. My uses are for hobby and scale model work, it fills that niche very well. Easy to clean up unlike my Paasche siphon feed brush, and super easy to dial in the work at hand. Very well made-you can see and feel the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the airbrush that came with my compressor and wow what a difference I love this thing it works great makes paining a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Thunder Struck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade over my first cheap airbrush. I could instantly tell the difference. I love it so far. And it was delivered in like 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Kennedy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money. Can’t go wrong. Great beginner brush or backup.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth action. Easy to clean. Most Paint flows without having to thin depending on brand. Feels great in your hand compared to others in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Team Frankenmerc

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great airbrush for the newbie. Works as it should, easy to clean. It will last forever if taken care of
customer_reviews.author: NeedRangeTime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: I loved working with this one it's the first syphon one for me and I really like it, handles like a dream and got my projects done in no time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the cheap knock offs
customer_reviews.text: So I've gone with the master Precision air brushes before and I've always kind of struggled doing fine lines or just getting a consistent pattern and finally I can say that I am able to do all those things now
customer_reviews.author: Richie rich

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this is a great brush no clogging no splattering. Great for beginners or pros
customer_reviews.author: raabana

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and what you expect from Iwata.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality for entry and intermediate. Depends on the use. Great for general everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Arnold

customer_reviews.title: This airbrush is NOT an Iwata airbrush
customer_reviews.text: The only thing this airbrush is good for in my opinion is stenciling or shading. You cant detail with it because the fan pattern isn't small at all. Its a Chinese knock off made FOR Iwata and I should have paid more attention because it clearly shows on the picture.( In smaller print).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: got this for my boyfriend and he loves it!!!!! says it’s very easy to use and he’s painting a lot with it
customer_reviews.author: Vickiv

customer_reviews.title: Did not expect the results
customer_reviews.text: Paint continually spits out regardless of mixture and thinner. My cheaper model works better than this one. Very disappointed in the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: If there is a better one, I can't imagine it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Does this thing ever do the trick. Works right out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Whidbey Island Travelers

customer_reviews.title: good for the starter
customer_reviews.text: If you don't know what to get for the first airbrushing for scale models, this is the best to start in my opinion. satisfied with the quality of NEO even though it is not made in japan like other Iwata models.
customer_reviews.author: Master Nokorimono

customer_reviews.title: It is ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: It could be a little betteer but my nozzle broke rather quickly
customer_reviews.author: berry

customer_reviews.title: This is best I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: love this can do great detail and easy to control and clean
customer_reviews.author: paceman

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've bought, which is the first airbrush I've owned. I accidentally broke the nozzle in a way that ruined the entire airbrush, completely my fault though. I've had good results with this and it's not really expensive.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walruff

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: The Needle Chucking Guide (an interior component) broke the 2nd time I used it. Returned to seller for refund (still waiting). Had read good reviews of this model. Will be going with a different brand, as the build quality was clearly very poor on this airbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Red Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Item came with a missing rear body.Needle was found with paint residue indicating it was used before.Totally disappointed with the item.Item was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Works great pretty easy to clean a definite step up from the master brand airbrush I had purchased, not the best for very fine detail at least not with the needle included and I’m not sure if you can use other sizes overall good buy
customer_reviews.author: James C Evans

customer_reviews.title: Best Airbrush for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great air brush Save your money on others and buy this one
customer_reviews.author: Hitech

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Airbrush
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! It's my favorite airbrush I own. The removable cups are nice for doing large paint jobs and small, detail work. Also I find cleaning this is easier with the removable cups. This is a great product for any beginners trying to learn something new!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Chekan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome airbrush at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love my Neo - it's solidly built, easy to use, and easy to take apart and clean. Paired with the Master Airbrush compressor/tank combo, it's been a dream to use!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner airbrush
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner airbrush. Quality metal parts and great handling. I am just getting started and I look forward to using this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Tuong-Vi Thi Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I have had a lot of problems with this and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of problems with this and the one that made me give it a two star it the fact that I have a hard time getting a constant spray out of it. hit and miss with paint coming out. Still working with it but not much luck yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great starter and novice airbrush
customer_reviews.text: Ive had 3 of these already and they're so go i recommend them to everybody.
customer_reviews.author: DIGGY

customer_reviews.title: Greeeeeat airbrush!!
customer_reviews.text: You definitely get what you pay for when it comes to airbrushes and supplies and this is a top notch product. Im a recent newbie to airbrushing and started with some 20$ guns and 30$ ones. I decided to try out the Neo and it blows them out the water!
customer_reviews.author: Ben B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister who's a makeup artist, and she's still using it and hasn't complained about it.
customer_reviews.author: Hirayoki22

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money the cheap ones are a gamble
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchase less expensive but they were inferior to this one. The cheap ones stopped working would not dispense liquid but this brand has been the best if you get it for under $80 stock up I bought 2 .
customer_reviews.author: twill832

customer_reviews.title: Tip broke off inside the nozzle in less than a year of use. Completely worthless now.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner and was looking forward to trying this since it had great reviews. I've had it for less than a year and the nozzle snapped off inside the housing. It clogged regularly but when it did actually spray, I was pretty happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: First airbrush I've used and its very user friendly and ...
customer_reviews.text: First airbrush I've used and its very user friendly and works really well. I can be very precise if need be with a little care.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until I cleaned it and the nozzle broke. Ridiculously small parts.
customer_reviews.author: jhopper

customer_reviews.title: Was working well until today it would push anything through ...
customer_reviews.text: Was working well until today it would push anything through. In trying to diagnose it I consulted the manual and attempted to remove the nozzle using the supplied spanner wrench. Then the threads of the nozzle broke off. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Sent without nozzle, fortunately I am a professional airbrush artist who bought this for a beginner family member. If bought by amateur, no way they would have ever known what was wrong with it... I am assuming a return without pretest sending back into the world......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, no compromise.
customer_reviews.text: Gravity feed was reason for the buy. Price was a factor. Had to buy Iwata hose. Quality seems high. Good weight.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after using about 5 times in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a good purchase at first. After using it about 5 times over a 2 month period it broke in my hand. All of the insides found a way to come apart. I have been unable to put it back together. It was cleaned after each use as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Brundage

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is an all around decent buy for airbrush artists. It worked well for a month but then the tip broke.
customer_reviews.author: Battmelk

customer_reviews.title: If you are just starting out, you cannot go wrong with this airbrush.
customer_reviews.text: Great airbrush for the beginner on a budget, I love it! Well made, quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Worship Cthulhu

customer_reviews.title: Great deal Iwata air brush gun!  And always works great!
customer_reviews.text: LOve it love it, love it! Great deal on Iwata. I have used this air brush for a while. I usually use alcohol based paint on this gun. It never gives me hard time. Always works great, I will keep buying this Neo from now on.
customer_reviews.author: H. Sawada

customer_reviews.title: Good airbrush. Ran into some clogging issues but that ...
customer_reviews.text: Good airbrush. Ran into some clogging issues but that was of my doing not thinning the paint enough. Works fine. Button is good to press and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: acousticmany

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I use it as my modeling air airbrush, works really well. cleaning is easy and never get stuck. Recommend to use low pressure on japan paints
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up for entry level and solid tool
customer_reviews.text: Pretty smooth compared to those crappy cheapie ones sold in Amazon by far
customer_reviews.author: pauldjameson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: New to airbrushing and this really is a ‘cheap’ quality airbrush. The entire gun was smooth working right out of the box, the entire cup was chromed allowing no paint to quickly dry and stain in the cup. Super easy to clean and it’s nice to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Does was it says.
customer_reviews.text: Great airbrush for a begginner like me. I use it for scale modelling and had no issues. Nice flow, not splotchy, fairly easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent airbrush!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic build quality. Just beautiful. It can handle properly thinned acrylics. Be sure to reduce your paints before you try much detail. However, this thing can deliver! Feels like it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kodak Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great all around airbrush.
customer_reviews.text: I love this airbrush. This the second one I have now, and the older one still works as well as this new one.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene S.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. The trigger is smooth and spraying is very fine and great for detail. I have a Badger too and I like this brush more. Its now my goto brush and my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher V Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: Just get it.
customer_reviews.text: Get it. It’s great, it can go from detail to big surface coverage in the matter of seconds without any mechanical adjustment. I’d get another! I use it for Gunpla and it goes above and beyond when doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: MammaLuigi78

customer_reviews.title: Great for priming and basing miniatures!
customer_reviews.text: I am sure it has other uses, but it works perfect for priming and basing miniatures. So easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: sara siegel

customer_reviews.title: Great Airbrush
customer_reviews.text: Really liking this airbrush. Wish it came with different sized needles, but it works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Adams

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 60 days
customer_reviews.text: Worst airbrush I've had so far. Already throwed it away and that will be the last Iwata product for me. The Paasche VL is a much better airbrush than the neo for about the same price. Learned my lesson !
customer_reviews.author: josey wales

customer_reviews.title: Great airbrush
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner, this airbrush is great. Easy to clean and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Larry George

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price, go for it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing airbrush, if you are a begginer don't go for anything less. After some free to upgrade to the Iwata hpc+. I am attaching some of the artworks I made using ONLY this airbrush
customer_reviews.author: Aviel ziv

customer_reviews.title: nicely built, feels very solid
customer_reviews.text: nicely built, feels very solid, easy to clean, and does a great job on thin detail lines. great for the starter airbrusher.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Iwata meadea Neo
customer_reviews.text: Great airbrush for the price point. Easy to use and easy to clean. Good even spray patterns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great airbrush for the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Quality built. Great for beginners to advanced uses. Able to draw a fine line with trigger control. All around a great airbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Good for money
customer_reviews.text: I use it for scale models. Like other say, little experiment to get thinning right, after that works great UPDATE-- Well in less that 6 months of light use had to replace needle and nozzle split Going to invest in a real iwata an hope it lasts
customer_reviews.author: RandyS

product_meta.title: NEO CN Gravity Feed Dual Action Airbrush
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Start airbrushing now with the NEO series for Iwata. It�s easier than ever to start with an economical and reliable airbrush backed by the most trusted name in the industry. These versatile, value-priced airbrushes can be used with a variety of different paints and mediums. Plus, the NEO series proves easy to use and clean. The NEO series for Iwata was designed to perform well at lower pressures when used with smaller air compressors. Iwata backs the NEO series airbrushes with an unprecedented five-year warranty. These versatile, value-priced airbrushes can be used with a variety of different paints and mediums. Plus, the NEO series proves easy to use and clean. Preferred when working in small to medium sized areas with small amounts of paint. Gravity-feed airbrushes perform well at lower air pressures, which help create greater detail. A unique 0.35-mm needle and nozzle combination for finer detail spraying and medium-sized spray patterns. Includes interchangeable large (1/3 oz.) and medium (1/16 oz.) cups designed with a funnel shape, which makes for easy clean-up and more efficient paint flow. (Airbrush will hold 1/32 oz. without a cup attached). Ideal operation is between 5 and 35 psi. Ideal for use with smaller air compressors that produce a maximum of 20 psi. Ideal for use with smaller air compressors that produce a maximum of 20 psi.
feature_bullets: Gravity-feed airbrushes perform well at lower air pressures, which help create greater detail
A unique 0.35-mm needle and nozzle combination for finer detail spraying and medium-sized spray patterns
Includes interchangeable large (1/3 oz.) and medium (1/16 oz.) cups designed with a funnel shape, which makes for easy clean-up and more efficient paint flow
Ideal operation is between 5 and 35 psi
Ideal for use with smaller air compressors that produce a maximum of 20 psi
